intro: Hibbertia appressa, commonly known as the small-flowered hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Hibbertia appressa has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers throughout the spring and summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive floral display.
